actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To eliminate the retroactive effect on Federal retirement benefits of the repeal of the 3-year basis recovery rule by the Tax Reform Act of 1986.

summary.text: Provides that in the case of Federal annuities, the repeal of the three-year basis recovery rule by the Tax Reform Act of 1986 shall apply only in cases where the starting date is after the date of the enactment of such Act. Allows six months after the date of enactment of this Act for claims for refund or credit of any overpayment of tax which would otherwise be barred by Federal law or regulation.

titles.title: To eliminate the retroactive effect on Federal retirement benefits of the repeal of the 3-year basis recovery rule by the Tax Reform Act of 1986.
